trans-unit.source: How to use Queue storage from .NET | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Queue storage from .NET | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Microsoft Azure Queue storage to create and delete queues and insert, peek, get, and delete queue messages.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Microsoft Azure Queue storage to create and delete queues and insert, peek, get, and delete queue messages.

trans-unit.source: How to use Queue storage from .NET
trans-unit.target: How to use Queue storage from .NET

trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.target: This guide will show you how to perform common scenarios using the

trans-unit.source: Azure Queue storage service.
trans-unit.target: Azure Queue storage service.

trans-unit.target: The samples are written in C\# code

trans-unit.source: and use the Azure Storage Client for .NET.
trans-unit.target: and use the Azure Storage Client for .NET.

trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include **inserting**,

trans-unit.target: **peeking**, **getting**, and **deleting** queue messages, as well as

trans-unit.source: Change the contents of a queued message
trans-unit.target: Change the contents of a queued message

trans-unit.source: You can change the contents of a message in-place in the queue.
trans-unit.target: You can change the contents of a message in-place in the queue.

trans-unit.source: If the
trans-unit.target: If the

trans-unit.target: message represents a work task, you could use this feature to update the

trans-unit.target: status of the work task.

trans-unit.target: The following code updates the queue message

trans-unit.source: with new contents, and sets the visibility timeout to extend another 60
trans-unit.target: with new contents, and sets the visibility timeout to extend another 60

trans-unit.source: seconds.
trans-unit.target: seconds.

trans-unit.source: This saves the state of work associated with the message, and
trans-unit.target: This saves the state of work associated with the message, and

trans-unit.source: gives the client another minute to continue working on the message.
trans-unit.target: gives the client another minute to continue working on the message.

trans-unit.target: You

trans-unit.source: could use this technique to track multi-step workflows on queue
trans-unit.target: could use this technique to track multi-step workflows on queue

trans-unit.source: messages, without having to start over from the beginning if a
trans-unit.target: messages, without having to start over from the beginning if a

trans-unit.source: processing step fails due to hardware or software failure.
trans-unit.target: processing step fails due to hardware or software failure.

trans-unit.source: Typically,
trans-unit.target: Typically,

trans-unit.source: you would keep a retry count as well, and if the message is retried more
trans-unit.target: you would keep a retry count as well, and if the message is retried more

trans-unit.source: than *n* times, you would delete it.
trans-unit.target: than *n* times, you would delete it.

trans-unit.target: This protects against a message

trans-unit.source: that triggers an application error each time it is processed.

trans-unit.source: De-queue the next message
trans-unit.target: De-queue the next message

trans-unit.source: Your code de-queues a message from a queue in two steps.
trans-unit.target: Your code de-queues a message from a queue in two steps.

trans-unit.source: When you call
trans-unit.target: When you call

trans-unit.source: **GetMessage**, you get the next message in a queue.
trans-unit.target: **GetMessage**, you get the next message in a queue.

trans-unit.source: A message returned
trans-unit.target: A message returned

trans-unit.source: from **GetMessage** becomes invisible to any other code reading messages
trans-unit.target: from **GetMessage** becomes invisible to any other code reading messages

trans-unit.source: from this queue.
trans-unit.target: from this queue.

trans-unit.source: By default, this message stays invisible for 30
trans-unit.target: By default, this message stays invisible for 30

trans-unit.source: seconds.
trans-unit.target: seconds.

trans-unit.source: To finish removing the message from the queue, you must also
trans-unit.target: To finish removing the message from the queue, you must also

trans-unit.source: call **DeleteMessage**.
trans-unit.target: call **DeleteMessage**.

trans-unit.source: This two-step process of removing a message
trans-unit.target: This two-step process of removing a message

trans-unit.source: assures that if your code fails to process a message due to hardware or
trans-unit.target: assures that if your code fails to process a message due to hardware or

trans-unit.source: software failure, another instance of your code can get the same message
trans-unit.target: software failure, another instance of your code can get the same message

trans-unit.source: and try again.
trans-unit.target: and try again.

trans-unit.source: Your code calls **DeleteMessage** right after the message
trans-unit.target: Your code calls **DeleteMessage** right after the message

trans-unit.source: has been processed.
trans-unit.target: has been processed.

trans-unit.source: Use Async-Await pattern with common Queue storage APIs
trans-unit.target: Use Async-Await pattern with common Queue storage APIs

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to use the Async-Await pattern with common Queue storage APIs.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to use the Async-Await pattern with common Queue storage APIs.

trans-unit.source: The sample calls the asynchronous version of each of the given methods, as indicated by the *Async* suffix of each method.
trans-unit.target: The sample calls the asynchronous version of each of the given methods, as indicated by the *Async* suffix of each method.

trans-unit.source: When an async method is used, the async-await pattern suspends local execution until the call completes.
trans-unit.target: When an async method is used, the async-await pattern suspends local execution until the call completes.

trans-unit.source: This behavior allows the current thread to do other work, which helps avoid performance bottlenecks and improves the overall responsiveness of your application.
trans-unit.target: This behavior allows the current thread to do other work, which helps avoid performance bottlenecks and improves the overall responsiveness of your application.

trans-unit.source: For more details on using the Async-Await pattern in .NET see [Async and Await (C# and Visual Basic)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh191443.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more details on using the Async-Await pattern in .NET see [Async and Await (C# and Visual Basic)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh191443.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Leverage additional options for de-queuing messages
trans-unit.target: Leverage additional options for de-queuing messages

trans-unit.source: There are two ways you can customize message retrieval from a queue.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways you can customize message retrieval from a queue.

trans-unit.source: First, you can get a batch of messages (up to 32).
trans-unit.target: First, you can get a batch of messages (up to 32).

trans-unit.source: Second, you can set a
trans-unit.target: Second, you can set a

trans-unit.source: longer or shorter invisibility timeout, allowing your code more or less
trans-unit.target: longer or shorter invisibility timeout, allowing your code more or less

trans-unit.source: time to fully process each message.
trans-unit.target: time to fully process each message.

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses the
trans-unit.target: The following code example uses the

trans-unit.source: **GetMessages** method to get 20 messages in one call.
trans-unit.target: **GetMessages** method to get 20 messages in one call.

trans-unit.source: Then it processes
trans-unit.target: Then it processes

trans-unit.source: each message using a **foreach** loop.
trans-unit.target: each message using a **foreach** loop.

trans-unit.source: It also sets the invisibility
trans-unit.target: It also sets the invisibility

trans-unit.source: timeout to five minutes for each message.
trans-unit.target: timeout to five minutes for each message.

trans-unit.source: Note that the 5 minutes starts
trans-unit.target: Note that the 5 minutes starts

trans-unit.source: for all messages at the same time, so after 5 minutes have passed since
trans-unit.target: for all messages at the same time, so after 5 minutes have passed since

trans-unit.source: the call to **GetMessages**, any messages which have not been deleted
trans-unit.target: the call to **GetMessages**, any messages which have not been deleted

trans-unit.source: will become visible again.
trans-unit.target: will become visible again.

trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.target: **FetchAttributes** method asks the Queue service to

trans-unit.target: The **ApproximateMethodCount**
